de.a46.memory
Class TextGetter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.a46.memory.TextGetter
public class TextGetter
extends java.lang.Object

Class TextGetter is used to read a text from a file. This file should be ascii, linefeeds can be WINDOWS, MAC or UNIX. An empty line marks, that a new period is starting. More than one empty line will cause empty periods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke

Constructor Summary
TextGetter(java.net.URL url)
          Constructs a new TextGetter.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String[][] getText()
          returns the text as an 2-dimensional array of Strings.
 void init()
          reads the text from the url specified in the constructor.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

TextGetter

public TextGetter(java.net.URL url)
Constructs a new TextGetter.
Parameters:
url - an URL pointing to the textFile to get read in.
Method Detail

init

public void init()
reads the text from the url specified in the constructor. To get the text, call getText(). If there is any error during reading the text, the exception tree is printed to System.err. In this case getText() will return null.

getText

public java.lang.String[][] getText()
returns the text as an 2-dimensional array of Strings. First dimension contains all periods, second represents the lines.
Returns:
a String[][] that is previously read in by init(), otherwise null if init() not yet has been called, or any error happened by reading and converting the file.
